001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005
006import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateMatrixFunction;
007import org.apache.commons.math3.analysis.MultivariateVectorFunction;
008
009/**
010 * Nonlinear optimizer based on the Levenberg-Marquart method, where the Jacobian matrix
011 * is calculated numerically (i.e., by estimating the first partial derivatives from
012 * finite differences). The advantage is that the calculation of the Jacobian is 
013 * independent of the calibration model, while performance and runtime are similar to
014 * the analytic version (see {@link NonlinearOptimizerAnalytic}).
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 */
018public class NonlinearOptimizerNumeric extends NonlinearOptimizer {
019        
020        protected NonlinearOptimizerNumeric(Point2D[] modelPts, Point2D[][] obsPts) {
021                super(modelPts, obsPts);
022        }
023        
024        @Override
025        MultivariateVectorFunction makeValueFun() {
026                return new ValueFun();
027        }
028
029        @Override
030        MultivariateMatrixFunction makeJacobianFun() {
031                return new JacobianFun();
032        }
033
034        private class JacobianFun implements MultivariateMatrixFunction {
035                
036                /**
037                 * Calculates a "stacked" Jacobian matrix with 2MN rows and K = 7 + 6M
038                 * columns (for M views with N points each, K parameters). For example, 
039                 * with M = 5 views and N = 256 points each, J is of size 2560 Ã— 37.
040                 * Each pair of rows in the Jacobian corresponds to one point.
041                 * THIS VERSION only calculates single blocks of the Jacobian!
042                 */
043                @Override
044            public double[][] value(double[] params) {
045                        final int K = params.length;
046                double[][] J = new double[2 * M * N][K];        // the Jacobian matrix (initialized to zeroes!)
047                double[] refValues = new double[2 * M * N];     // values obtained with undisturbed parameters 
048                
049                double[] a = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, 0, camParLength);       // camera parameters
050                Camera camOrig = new Camera(a);
051                
052                // Step 0: calculate all 2MN reference output values (for undisturbed parameters)
053               
054                for (int r = 0, i = 0; i < M; i++) {    // for all views, r = row
055                        int m = camParLength + viewParLength * i;
056                                double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, m, m + viewParLength);
057                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
058                        for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {   // for all model points: calculate reference values
059                                double[] uv = camOrig.project(view, modelPts[j]);
060                                refValues[r + 0] = uv[0];
061                                refValues[r + 1] = uv[1];
062                                r = r + 2;
063                        }                
064                }
065                
066                // Step 1: calculate the leftmost (green) block of J associated with camera intrinsics
067                
068                for (int k = 0; k < a.length; k++) {    // for all camera parameters
069                        double ak = a[k];                                       // keep original parameter value        
070                        double delta = estimateDelta(ak);
071                        a[k] = a[k] + delta;            // modify parameter s_k
072                        Camera camMod = new Camera(a);  // modified camera
073                        
074                        for (int r = 0, i = 0; i < M; i++) {    // for all views, r = row
075                                int m = camParLength + i * viewParLength;
076                                double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, m, m + viewParLength);
077                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
078                                for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {   // for all model points: calculate disturbed value
079                                        Point2D Pj = modelPts[j];
080                                        double[] uvMod = camMod.project(view, Pj);
081                                        J[r + 0][k] = (uvMod[0] - refValues[r + 0]) / delta;   // dX
082                                        J[r + 1][k] = (uvMod[1] - refValues[r + 1]) / delta;   // dY
083                                        r = r + 2;
084                                }    
085                        }
086                        a[k] = ak;      // return parameter s_k to original
087                }
088                
089                // Step 2: calculate the diagonal blocks, one for each view
090                
091                for (int i = 0; i < M; i++) {   // for all views/blocks
092                        final int start = camParLength + i * viewParLength;
093                        double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, start, start + viewParLength);
094                        final int c = a.length + i * w.length;          // leftmost matrix column of block i
095                        for (int k = 0; k < w.length; k++) {    // for all parameters in w
096                                double wk = w[k];                                       // keep original parameter w_k
097                                double delta = estimateDelta(wk);
098                                w[k] =  w[k] + delta;                           // modify parameter w_k
099                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
100                                int r = 2 * i * N;      // row
101                                for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {           // for all model points: calculate disturbed value
102                                        Point2D Pj = modelPts[j];
103                                        double[] uvMod = camOrig.project(view, Pj);
104                                        J[r + 0][c + k] = (uvMod[0] - refValues[r + 0]) / delta;   // dX
105                                        J[r + 1][c + k] = (uvMod[1] - refValues[r + 1]) / delta;   // dY
106                                        r = r + 2;
107                                } 
108                                w[k] = wk; // w[k] - DELTA;             // return parameter w_k to original
109                        }
110                }
111                
112//                      long endtime = System.nanoTime();
113//                      System.out.println("time diff = " + (endtime - starttime) + " ns");
114//              System.out.println(NonlinearOptimizerNumeric.class.getSimpleName() + 
115//                              ": Jacobian inverse condition number = " + MathUtil.inverseConditionNumber(J));
116                return J;
117            }
118                
119                 // THIS VERSION calculates all entries of the Jacobian (NOT USED)!
120            
121            @Deprecated
122            @SuppressWarnings("unused")
123                public double[][] value(double[] params, boolean dummy) {
124                //long starttime = System.nanoTime();
125                //System.out.println("getJacobianMatrix - NUMERICAL");
126                // M = number of views, N = number of model points
127                double[][] J = new double[2 * M * N][params.length];    // the Jacobian matrix
128                double[] refValues = new double[2 * M * N];     // function values obtained with undisturbed parameters 
129                
130                double[] s = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, 0, camParLength);
131                Camera cam = new Camera(s);
132                
133                // Step 0: calculate all 2MN reference output values (for undisturbed parameters)
134                
135                for (int row = 0, m = 0; m < M; m++) {  // for all views
136                        int start = camParLength + m * viewParLength;
137                                double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, start, start + viewParLength);
138                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
139                        for (int j = 0; j < N; j++) {   // for all model points: calculate reference values
140                                double[] uv = cam.project(view, modelPts[j]);
141                                refValues[row + 0] = uv[0];
142                                refValues[row + 1] = uv[1];
143                                row = row + 2;
144                        }                
145                }
146                
147                // Step 1: calculate all entries of the Jacobian (brute force!)
148                
149                for (int k = 0; k < params.length; k++) {       // for ALL parameters
150                        int col = k;
151                        // calculate step width and modify the parameter vector c:
152                        double pk = params[k];
153                        double delta = estimateDelta(pk);
154                        params[k] = params[k] + delta;          // modify parameter c_k
155                        
156                        double[] smod = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, 0, camParLength);
157                        Camera camMod = new Camera(smod);       // modified camera
158                        
159                        for (int row = 0, m = 0; m < M; m++) {  // for all views
160                                int start = camParLength + m * viewParLength;
161                                double[] w = Arrays.copyOfRange(params, start, start + viewParLength);
162                                ViewTransform view = new ViewTransform(w);
163                                for (int n = 0; n < N; n++) {   // for all model points: calculate disturbed value
164                                        Point2D Pj = modelPts[n];
165                                        double[] uvMod = camMod.project(view, Pj);
166                                        J[row + 0][col] = (uvMod[0] - refValues[row + 0]) / delta;   // du
167                                        J[row + 1][col] = (uvMod[1] - refValues[row + 1]) / delta;   // dv      
168                                        row = row + 2;
169                                }    
170                        }
171                        params[k] = pk;
172                }
173               
174                long endtime = System.nanoTime();
175//                      System.out.println("time diff = " + (endtime - starttime) + " ns");
176//                      System.out.println(this.getClass().getSimpleName() + 
177//                              ": Jacobian inverse condition number = " + MathUtil.inverseConditionNumber(J));
178                return J;
179            }
180
181        }
182        
183        /**
184         * Returns a positive delta value adapted to the magnitude of the parameter x
185         * @param x
186         * @return
187         */
188    private double estimateDelta(double x) {
189        final double eps = 1.5e-8;      // = sqrt(2.2 * 10^{-16})
190        double dx = eps * Math.max(Math.abs(x), 1); // dx >= eps
191        // avoid numerical truncation problems (add and subtract again) - 
192        // not sure if this survives the compiler !?
193        double tmp = x + dx;
194        return tmp - x;
195    }
196        
197}
198
